answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
This is a copy of the Infrastructure Report Card for Palo Alto, CA. 
http://www.cityofpaloalto.org/civica/filebank/blobdload.asp?BlobID=10963 
The American Society of Civil Engineers has a list of state and local infrastructure report cards for the communities they have partnered with.
http://www.infrastructurereportcard.org/state-and-local-report-cards
Section 7 of the 2011 Bellevue, Washington budget indicates the city is considering implementing a Capital Asset Assessment, Maintenance and Replacement Policy.
http://www.bellevuewa.gov/pdf/Finance/Safe_Community_CIP_Proposals.pdf 
I hope these are a helpful start.
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Gregory Stopka
text:
I am researching ways in which cities have implemented an Infrastructure Report Card in accordance to the GFOA recommended practice of Capital Asset Assessment, Maintenance and Replacement Policy. 
Are there any cities that have such report cards?
title: Infrastructure Report Cards
